review.response: [{"name": "bugs", "items": [{"message": "Inconsistent handling of null types in `isAssignable(Type type, Class<?> toClass)` and `isAssignable(Type type, Type toType, Map<TypeVariable<?>, Type> typeVarAssigns)` methods. In the former, a null type is considered assignable to non-null classes, while in the latter, it's not. This inconsistency might lead to unexpected behavior."}, {"message": "In the `isAssignable(Type type, Type toType, Map<TypeVariable<?>, Type> typeVarAssigns)` method, there's no handling for the case when `toType` is an instance of `GenericArrayType`. This could potentially lead to a `ClassCastException` if such a type is encountered."}, {"message": "The Javadoc for the `isAssignable(Type type, Type toType, Map<TypeVariable<?>, Type> typeVarAssigns)` method doesn't mention that `typeVarAssigns` is optional. It should be clarified that this parameter is only used when checking against `TypeVariable` types."}, {"message": "The Javadoc for the `TypeUtils` class mentions that it should not be constructed in standard programming, but the public constructor is still present. It might be a good idea to make this constructor protected or private to enforce this behavior."}]}]
